Message.Msg: Technically it should retrace to 10. But these days, anything is possible. You never know what is next. Every rally appears to be a short squeeze. The next rally will be a short squeeze of those who just established short positions today. That's the cause of the market surge, I guess.

Topic.Title: Mississippi Has Finally Definitely Ratified the Thirteenth Amendment

Message.Msg: What's your point? People in your beloved government make mistakes? What a news!

Topic.Title: Mississippi Has Finally Definitely Ratified the Thirteenth Amendment

Message.Msg: So looky who opposed women's right to vote: "During the beginning of the 20th century, as women's suffrage faced several important federal votes, a portion of the suffrage movement known as the National Women's Party led by suffragist Alice Paul became the first "cause" to picket outside the White House. Paul and Lucy Burns led a series of protests against the Wilson Administration in Washington. Wilson ignored the protests for six months, but on June 20, 1917, as a Russian delegation drove up to the White House, suffragists unfurled a banner which stated: "We women of America tell you that America is not a democracy. Twenty million women are denied the right to vote. President Wilson is the chief opponent of their national enfranchisement".[87] Another banner on August 14, 1917, referred to "Kaiser Wilson" and compared the plight of the German people with that of American women. With this manner of protest, the women were subject to arrests and many were jailed.[88] On October 17, Alice Paul was sentenced to seven months and on October 30 began a hunger strike, but after a few days prison authorities began to force feed her.[87] After years of opposition, Wilson changed his position in 1918 to advocate women's suffrage as a war measure.[89] The key vote came on June 4, 1919, when the Senate approved the amendment by 56 to 25 after four hours of debate, during which Democratic Senators opposed to the amendment filibustered to prevent a roll call until their absent Senators could be protected by pairs. The Ayes included 36 (82%) Republicans and 20 (54%) Democrats. The Nays comprised 8 (18%) Republicans and 17 (46%) Democrats. It was ratified by sufficient states in 1920, the Nineteenth Amendment, which prohibited state or federal sex-based restrictions on voting." Woodrow Wilson long time ignored the issue, most of the Democrats opposed it.

Topic.Title: Rand Paul gop/tea star said people and bussiness have a right to be racist and discriminatory

Message.Msg: Liberal Democrats argue that private individuals should have to tolerate passes by members of the same sex because to do otherwise would be discriminating based on sexual orientation. And the difference is? Remember ANY kind of government coericion over free speech or free exercise of opinion is an infringement on the first amendment unless the that speech has no meaningful value or is used to incite riots, civil unrest, or to provoke anarchy. Technically common carriers like Yahoo and Google shouldn't even be able to delete SPAM without a court case finding that SPAM has no legitimate 1st amendment protection. Putting it in the same class as kiddy porn and . . . well . . . just about nothing else but yelling fire in a crowded theater.

Message.Title: Minorities game plan revealed
Message.Msg: **Choudary, a father-of-four, claims more than £25,000 a year in benefits, £8,000 more than the take-home pay of some soldiers fighting the Taliban in Afghanistan** Sounds like our new illegal minority population here in the states. Let the schmucks work while they enjoy all the welfare benifits. We go to work so they can stay home and have babies and become the majority....liberalism is a mental disorder. A Muslim preacher is secretly filmed urging followers to take benefits from the state to fund a holy war. Anjem Choudary was secretly filmed mocking non-Muslims for working in 9-5 jobs their whole lives, and told followers that some revered Islamic figures had only ever worked one or two days a year. “The rest of the year they were busy with jihad [holy war] and things like that,” he said. “People will say, ‘Ah, but you are not working’. “But the normal situation is for you to take money from the kuffar [non-believers]. “So we take Jihad Seeker’s Allowance. You need to get support.” He went on to tell a 30-strong crowd: “We are going to take England — the Muslims are coming.” Ridiculing the daily lives of UK workers, Choudary said: “You find people are busy working the whole of their life. They wake up at 7 o’clock. They go to work at 9 o’clock. “They work for eight, nine hours a day. They come home at 7 o’clock, watch EastEnders, sleep, and they do that for 40 years of their life. That is called slavery.” Choudary, a father-of-four, claims more than £25,000 a year in benefits, £8,000 more than the take-home pay of some soldiers fighting the Taliban in Afghanistan, according to the Sun, which covertly filmed the preacher at three meetings.
**Why do you have to let the whole world know you are a partisan simpleton?** But not you, you are completely objective...lol

Message.Title: Gas prices up 32 days and counting
Message.Msg: The result of Bernanke and Obama's policies...and who does it hurt most, the poor and the middle class. Mean while Barry and Michelle are treating themselves to a $900.00 Valentines dinner... Social injustice I say! 32 days of higher gas prices comes at tough time Gas prices have risen for 32 days straight, according to AAA. That means that the average price for a gallon of regular unleaded gasoline has increased more than 13% over that period to $3.73. It#$%$ wallets right in the middle of winter, when people are already looking at large home heating bills. And it comes just after many Americans have been hit with smaller paychecks, and are worried about looming budget cuts that could deliver an even deeper blow.
